intro: Grindelia stricta f. venulosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a compact growth habit with multiple stems and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native range.
